156199461.review:
Okay, let's go, writing a messy review while my memory is still fresh...

I want to begin by saying I'm a [i]huge[/i] Holostars fan. (I can't vouch for what this game is like when you don't know Holostars.) You'll just have to take my word for it when I say I wouldn't blindly praise official Holostars content just because I'm a fan. By no means.
This is exactly why this caught me off guard. [b]This game is amazing.[/b] Honestly, I didn't expect it to be that intriguing and good. 

[hr][/hr]

[b]First off, it is just as violent as everyone including the content warnings say.[/b] I kind of can't put this into words, but I'm speaking as someone who's really bad with gore: I genuinely appreciate the amount of gruesomeness added? There were some graphic descriptions going with the CGs and I thought "They aren't fooling around here, they're serious about this stuff". It never felt like endless senseless splatter horror. In any other context this could've bordered on such an impression, but knowing how happy and silly Holostars often are, here the violence served as proof the team really wanted to make an AU that takes itself seriously.

[b]Also related, but this game handled AUs exactly the way I like it the most.[/b] It's a world different from the canon world, but it's the real world to most people in the game. Some characters know meta stuff, but absolutely not all of them do - which to me is the most interesting way to write AUs. It didn't devolve into a pure meta-references-fest, it didn't devolve into all the characters suddenly being comedic at the end of their route and being like "omg are we in a videogame about vtubers?! oh nyooo i'm just pixels!!!" Even the meta stuff was taken seriously in the game, and because it was well-written, it felt [i]believable[/i] to me.

[b]Checking off my last subjective points: [/b]
I'm a big fan of every Holostar, but from TEMPUS I vibe with Shinri the most. And I followed multiple people's advice to play the routes in debut order (Demon King>Exiled Prince>Showman>Abandoned Automaton>Karasu Demon>Huntsman, except I accidentally mixed Hakka's and Flay's ordering up at that point because I thought the route choices in the game were presented in debut order and thus blindly followed them after the first 3). Honestly, I think you'll get a lot of bang out of your buck as long as you start with Demon King and end with Huntsman. Because both seeing Shinri received this kind of doppelgänger AND seeing what exactly played out with him simply killed me tenfold and makes seeing the true ending directly afterwards hit as hard as possible.

And wrapping up another reason I think this game is incredibly well written: I've played a handful of VNs, including murder-y ones and romance-y ones. This is the literal first VN where I consistently felt the dialogue options led exactly to the player character using them like I interpreted the choices. I've always thought I'm horrible at VNs because dialogues never went the way I expected them to after choosing my desired option, so it was hugely comforting and positively surprising that for once, a game seemed to have understood what I was going for when I went with that option. 

[b]Finally, both the CG art and sprite art are amazing (the Showman's CG and the Huntsman's closed-eyes-laugh sprite are epic), and I'm glad about the sound design.[/b] They could've made a VN with crunchy af free SFX and way-too-known stock music, but I'm pleased their chosen sound design supported the game's atmosphere nicely.

[hr][/hr]

I can't write all this without voicing my mild critique. It's minor since my enjoyment of Doppelgänger wildly outweighs my complaints. 

[b]The bugged achievements are an obvious one.[/b] I'm still hoping they didn't just drop this game into the abyss and will never update it, because I'm not a skilled gamer that can 100% every game I touch - if I want to have any say and choice in what game I would love to 100%, it's Doppelgänger. Supporting the boys, supporting my love for this game.

[b]Also on a non-technical end, I did think the game was kind of short.[/b] It's incredible for its length, and I got some serious value out of it. In fact, while I think all the 6 main routes could've been longer, I don't think they can be an actual complaint point. [b]However, the [i]ending[/i] was so short it shocked me.[/b] I'm a sucker for happy ends, so it's definitely not about the vibe they went with. It just... felt so abrupt? Yeah, I did just go through 6 tragedies, you're right, game!! If you're not allowing me to bask in an attempt to change something about the doppelgänger's despair or see them again outside of their routes, at least let me live in the happy end a little longer!! If you want to make it a tad more ominous by being like "wow here you're hanging out with the nice guys :) all is well...................... but in the corner of your eye you see [hint of the doppelgängers].................. is everything really going to be okay?", whatever, I'd take it! I'd take a longer description of how the real TEMPUS' reunion plays out!! Just... give me a little more time with the in-game universe after we went through all that. Everything was so well-written, even the too-short ending felt like real conversations between everyone. So I would've loved to enjoy that just a bit longer, to feel like I was seen off in a more well-rounded way.

Nonetheless, as stated repeatedly,[b] I had a ton of fun with this game.[/b] "Pleasantly surprised" is an understatement. I'm very thankful to the Holostars Managers, the Holostars boys and everyone related that we are able to play this kind of high-quality game with dialogue that never felt out of place. I always knew they know what they're doing, but this proved they're insanely cracked at this kind of thing and I direly wish for more Holostars content like this. [b]Thank you so much for making this game, it was a blast to go through!![/b] [strike]Until then I'll live vicariously through bowing to my Doppelgänger acrylic standees weekly whenever they arrive.[/strike]

155775151.review: I got my tongue ripped out and stabbed in the heart by my oshi, good game.

155732924.review: amazing art and quality visual novel, i love the horribly unfunny showman and the yan abandoned automaton (the achievement with axel was pretty funny)

155534330.review:
Oh boy, the TEMPURA are in for a treat when you play this game! Pay attention to the content warning though, this is a horror VN, after all!

The game is short and very well written, otsuTEMPUS to the HOLOSTARS EN management team and talents!

The meta humor and references from across some TEMPUS streams are hilarious, [spoiler]finishing this game, as of writing, during TEMPUS Vanguard's Anniversary is a mistake, The Huntsman's route broke me[/spoiler], and the lore is enjoyable and fun to theorize about

The art for this game is great, the CG art too! Would definitely recommend this to every TEMPURA, it's an experience!

155323277.review:
Short but nice. Very cool work from tempus managers, they got the assignment right.

Loved seeing my usually wet cat oshis having the time of their life eating me alive, torturing me to death, blackmailing me or traumatizing me in various ways.

Hope they would patch the bugged achievement from shinri's route sometime soon though.

155217701.review:
This game hurts so good. The writing was great; had a lot of laughs at all the little references sprinkled in, and definitely teared up during others. Thank you Mane-sans and the boys for giving us such a wonderful game! Am sad to hear that some achievements are bugged for the time being, but I'll be a patient little Tempura and wait for the fix to roll out.

Do keep the content warnings in mind though.

155015539.review: I got eaten. Great experience. Would recommend.

154999582.review: Fun game, although a bit scarier than I expected! Do make sure you check out the content warnings so you aren't caught off guard. The art is lovely and the pacing of the game is great as well. It's on the shorter side, so it's definitely easy to do a route or two (or three) in one sitting. I would love to see more projects like this from the boys in the future!

154980855.review: Nice horror VN. Just be sure to read the content warnings!

154970004.review:
Doppelgänger遊戲心得
跑的順序是：Altare→Axel→Flayon→Shinri→Bettle→Hakka
六條線全通會有個Bonus結局，是常見操作的收尾，但我覺得剛剛經歷劇情上沖下洗的Tempuras會需要這種風格的Ending。
從幾個方面綜合評價一下：
音樂：整體優秀，根據不同角色背景設定有很適切的BGM，有幾首是我會想要之後DLC能單獨販售當作業音樂使用的。
結局CG：看起來是三個不同繪師分別繪製，有其中兩位的CG我覺得和立繪畫風有滿明顯的差異，會讓人一時之間比較適應不良，不過這是個人審美問題，不算缺點。
劇本：其實都是常見的劇情，但在對話選項中會適度融合直播哏或是liver個人的喜好這點，我覺得作為粉絲向遊戲來說非常優秀！這種遊戲的劇本最怕就是寫得OOC或解釋違，但我一整輪體驗下來其實很多次都被裡面的小彩蛋驚喜到，到最後跑工作人員名單看到全都是馬內甲，respect！
綜合體驗來說，我覺得跑起來最喜歡的是Bettle線，其次Flayon和Shinri不分軒輊，Axel的反轉跟最後的「哇」滿意外的，Hakka和Altare因為開頭都能直接猜到結尾，所以純作為視覺小說的話我評價會稍微普通一點。
然後英文程度好的人大概一小時內可以全通吧www
或是像我需要邊玩邊查字典邊分心的話可能就會拉長到四小時左右。

154954768.review:
The stories per characters are quite short. It'll take less than an hour to finish the whole game. 
If you are looking for a romantic otome or something with a good ending with any of the boys, this game is not for you. 
Achievements are bugged. If you fail to choose the correct answer, there is no turning back. I still haven't completed my Shinri and Flayon achievements because of that. Hope the achievement bugs get fixed soon.

154855788.review: It's a good quality VN. Unfortunately, I picked the huntsman's path first and now I'm sad. I'll come back to this game next year.

154778306.review:
It's short but truly incredible! I genuinely think even people who don't know what TEMPUS is can enjoy this game. It's seriously gratuitous with violence, but each moment of horror is truly beautiful. Best nightmare to be trapped in! Story is wonderful, thoughtful and emotion provoking. Art is absolutely gorgeous both in background, PV, and character art! The music is incredibly good and the sound design is solid. It was super fun to play and had me itching to do fanart and buy some copies for my non-tempura friends(time to convert).  I'm even more terrified of Regis Altare in a way I didn't know was possible lol

I can't thank the staff that worked on this and the TEMPUS boys enough!!!!

154496332.review: I finally played this game and this was an incredible experience, A HUGE THANKS to the manechans, the artists the programers, to the TEMPUS boys and everyone for this present. You did an amazing game, very interesting and fun experience. If you love the stars, this is a must have experience, I hope you pursue more projects like these going forward !

154479532.review:
From CG to voice acting, music and writing - everything was FANTASTIC. This was a true delight for someone with an insatiable thirst for HoloTempus lore haha. Eagerly anticipating a sequel or similar content of the sorts in the future, because this was really cool!

A heartfelt thank you for all the hard work you've put into creating this, amazing job! <3

154431300.review:
As a TEMPUS fan, obviously, I am extremely appreciative of what the Mane-sans have given us and I love the little references they made for the boys. I also love the voice acting, the art is amazing, and the music was just a vibe!

With that being said, as someone who plays a lot of visual novels, I'll review this outside of a Tempura perspective. It's short and quick so don't expect something that's incredibly lore-heavy and detailed. I enjoyed seeing other sides of the boys but I think the routes were trying to tease this project called "Doppelganger" that's done inside the Other Elysium but it ultimately didn't really explain what was going on. I had a lot of questions like [spoiler] how come Altare and Shinri could see through/communicate with their doppelganger? How did the MC wound up in Other Elysium? There's also this eerie setting up of MC's name (are you sure about your name? What WAS your name?) so I expected there to be a plot twist for the MC. How come MC was able to traverse different routes despite dying in some of them? [/spoiler] I wanted to get answers to these questions since it was heavily teased throughout the game. The truth was a cute scene but I really wish it had some drama or something but that's just me.

Anyways, overall, I recommend this to all Tempura! You get to see a different side of the boys and it was a fun read. I hope there's a part two so we can explore the world more. Thank you again to the team that worked on this!

154394907.review: Played it and of course I Chose Autotamon(Flayon) as my first route.........i tried for 1 hour and a half to get a happy ending to realize there was only bad endings........I laughed manically when i chose Showman(Bettel's) route and cried during Huntsman (Shinri's) route.......For Demon King (Altare) I got to punch him <3 which i'm happy, because he will never know c:

154381160.review: It is what I expected when I first start playing this game. It doesn't take long to get through each routes but I do recommend you on saving Shinri / Huntsman as last.

154198261.review:
The backgrounds, CG's, music, writing and character design are completeley well thought out according to the personality or lore of the TEMPUS boys. 

Personally the music was very enjoyable and it felt perfect for each route. Also the references that have passed in the streams are great!

I would have loved for the boys to talk more + a longer game, but that does't take away the gratitude to the manes for all their work together and everyone who participated in the production of the game. Thank you and I hope we can have more projects like this in the future <3.

154174376.review: Games fun, enjoyed the CGs, stories were interesting, unsure about 2 of the achievements though I went back to try to get it but it wouldn't trigger for Emotional turmoil and Bully

154162346.review: I have no idea what the first game is or who these characters are but it was a good set of six short stories with a true ending.  The art is beautiful, the music, sound/visual effects, CG, story, dialogue, and true ending are nice.  Getting keys is fun to open the door back to your world.  I think this is some kind of fan game but the real characters are so cute and not flashy like the first ones.  I liked it and I understand that one playthrough of the game is like 1 hour if you speed read like I did and it's supposed to be around 2 if you get all the achievements but I am satisfied.  I feel like it's a little expensive but you pay for quality.  Nice game.  It's really short and expensive so I give it a 9/10 also it scared the heck out of me especially the Demon King lol.  The meta part was cool too with real dates and times.

154151745.review:
Fantastic Fan Game from Mane-Sans to the Tempuras! It was such a joy to play it, even if at some points I shrieked out of terror, haha.
Definitely recommend it to other Tempus fans!

The only negative thing I could say with the Steam Version is that I noticed 2 achievements (if not done correctly on the first run) are not attainable afterwards. If that could get fixed completionists like me would be very happy!

154131255.review: they knew what they were doing with the aniki achievement
